org.jruyi.timeoutadmin

Interface ITimeoutNotifier


  • public interface ITimeoutNotifier
    A ITimeoutNotifier is used to schedule a timeout notification of the interested subject. It has 4 states in all. They are Unscheduled, Scheduled, TimedOut and Closed.

    The state transitions are listed below. 

     [Unscheduled] --(schedule)-> [Scheduled]
 [Scheduled] --(cancel)-> [Unscheduled]
 [Scheduled] --(timeout)-> [TimedOut]
 [TimedOut] --(reset)-> [Unscheduled]
 [Scheduled | Unscheduled | TimedOut] --(close)-> [Closed]

    When ITimeoutNotifier is created, the initial state is Unscheduled. Except close event, when 2 more events occur concurrently, only the one winning the lock will be taken. The others will fail fast.

    When ITimeoutNotifier goes into state TimedOut, schedule/ cancel will not work until it gets reset.

    After ITimeoutNotifier closes, it will not work anymore.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int CLOSED
      An int value representing Closed state.
      static int SCHEDULED
      An int value representing Scheduled state.
      static int TIMEDOUT
      An int value representing Timedout state.
      static int UNSCHEDULED
      An int value representing Unscheduled state.

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean cancel()
      Cancels the notifier.
      void close()
      Closes this notifier.
      Object getSubject()
      Returns the subject this notifier concerns.
      boolean reset()
      Resets this notifier to be able to be scheduled again if it timed out.
      boolean schedule(int timeout)
      Schedules a notification to be sent out in timeout seconds.
      void setListener(ITimeoutListener listener)
      Sets the listener that is interested in the notification.
      int state()
      Returns the current state of this notifier.

    • Method Detail

      • getSubject

        Object getSubject()
        Returns the subject this notifier concerns.
        Returns:
        the subject

      • state

        int state()
        Returns the current state of this notifier.
        Returns:
        the current state of this notifier

      • schedule

        boolean schedule(int timeout)
        Schedules a notification to be sent out in timeout seconds. The previous schedule will be dropped.
        Parameters:
        timeout - time in seconds in which the notifier will be sent
        Returns:
        false if this notifier timed out or is closed, otherwise true
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - if timeout is not positive

      • cancel

        boolean cancel()
        Cancels the notifier.
        Returns:
        false if either timeout or closed, otherwise true

      • reset

        boolean reset()
        Resets this notifier to be able to be scheduled again if it timed out.
        Returns:
        true if this notifier timed out, otherwise false

      • close

        void close()
        Closes this notifier.

      • setListener

        void setListener(ITimeoutListener listener)
        Sets the listener that is interested in the notification.
        Parameters:
        listener - the notification receiver
